stdint.h

00001 /* ISO C9x  7.18  Integer types <stdint.h>
00002  * Based on ISO/IEC SC22/WG14 9899 Committee draft (SC22 N2794)
00003  *
00004  *  THIS SOFTWARE IS NOT COPYRIGHTED
00005  *
00006  *  Contributor: Danny Smith <danny_r_smith_2001@yahoo.co.nz>
00007  *
00008  *  This source code is offered for use in the public domain. You may
00009  *  use, modify or distribute it freely.
00010  *
00011  *  This code is distributed in the hope that it will be useful but
00012  *  WITHOUT ANY WARRANTY. ALL WARRANTIES, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED ARE HEREBY
00013  *  DISCLAIMED. This includes but is not limited to warranties of
00014  *  MERCHANTABILITY or FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE.
00015  *
00016  *  Date: 2000-12-02
00017  *  Date: June 2005  JDPoirier   Cosemetic changes. Added __LP64__ check for defining
00018  *                               __WORDSIZE so there're no external header file
00019  *                               dependencies. WCHAR min/max changes. WINT_MIN
00020  *                               and WINT_MAX to signed values.
00021  */
00022 #ifndef _STDINT_H
00023 #define _STDINT_H
00024 
00025 #if __LP64__
00026     #define __WORDSIZE 64
00027 #else
00028     #define __WORDSIZE 32
00029 #endif
00030 
00031 /* 7.18.1.1  Exact-width integer types */
00032 typedef signed char         int8_t;
00033 typedef unsigned char       uint8_t;
00034 typedef short               int16_t;
00035 typedef unsigned short      uint16_t;
00036 typedef int                 int32_t;
00037 typedef unsigned            uint32_t;
00038 typedef long long           int64_t;
00039 typedef unsigned long long  uint64_t;
00040 
00041 /* 7.18.1.2  Minimum-width integer types */
00042 typedef signed char         int_least8_t;
00043 typedef unsigned char       uint_least8_t;
00044 typedef short               int_least16_t;
00045 typedef unsigned short      uint_least16_t;
00046 typedef int                 int_least32_t;
00047 typedef unsigned            uint_least32_t;
00048 typedef long long           int_least64_t;
00049 typedef unsigned long long  uint_least64_t;
00050 
00051 /*  7.18.1.3  Fastest minimum-width integer types
00052  *  Not actually guaranteed to be fastest for all purposes
00053  *  Here we use the exact-width types for 8 and 16-bit ints.
00054  */
00055 typedef char                int_fast8_t;
00056 typedef unsigned char       uint_fast8_t;
00057 typedef short               int_fast16_t;
00058 typedef unsigned short      uint_fast16_t;
00059 typedef int                 int_fast32_t;
00060 typedef unsigned  int       uint_fast32_t;
00061 typedef long long           int_fast64_t;
00062 typedef unsigned long long  uint_fast64_t;
00063 
00064 /* 7.18.1.4  Integer types capable of holding object pointers */
00065 #ifndef _INTPTR_T
00066     #define _INTPTR_T
00067     typedef int                 intptr_t;
00068 #endif
00069 
00070 #ifndef _UINTPTR_T
00071     #define _UINTPTR_T
00072     typedef unsigned            uintptr_t;
00073 #endif
00074 
00075 /* 7.18.1.5  Greatest-width integer types */
00076 typedef long long           intmax_t;
00077 typedef unsigned long long  uintmax_t;
00078 
00079 /* 7.18.2  Limits of specified-width integer types */
00080 #if !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined (__STDC_LIMIT_MACROS)
00081 
00082 /* 7.18.2.1  Limits of exact-width integer types */
00083 #define INT8_MIN        (-128)
00084 #define INT16_MIN       (-32768)
00085 #define INT32_MIN       (-2147483647 - 1)
00086 #define INT64_MIN       (-9223372036854775807LL - 1)
00087 
00088 #define INT8_MAX        127
00089 #define INT16_MAX       32767
00090 #define INT32_MAX       2147483647
00091 #define INT64_MAX       9223372036854775807LL
00092 
00093 #define UINT8_MAX       0xff /* 255U */
00094 #define UINT16_MAX      0xffff /* 65535U */
00095 #define UINT32_MAX      0xffffffff  /* 4294967295U */
00096 #define UINT64_MAX      0xffffffffffffffffULL /* 18446744073709551615ULL */
00097 
00098 /* 7.18.2.2  Limits of minimum-width integer types */
00099 #define INT_LEAST8_MIN      INT8_MIN
00100 #define INT_LEAST16_MIN     INT16_MIN
00101 #define INT_LEAST32_MIN     INT32_MIN
00102 #define INT_LEAST64_MIN     INT64_MIN
00103 
00104 #define INT_LEAST8_MAX      INT8_MAX
00105 #define INT_LEAST16_MAX     INT16_MAX
00106 #define INT_LEAST32_MAX     INT32_MAX
00107 #define INT_LEAST64_MAX     INT64_MAX
00108 
00109 #define UINT_LEAST8_MAX     UINT8_MAX
00110 #define UINT_LEAST16_MAX    UINT16_MAX
00111 #define UINT_LEAST32_MAX    UINT32_MAX
00112 #define UINT_LEAST64_MAX    UINT64_MAX
00113 
00114 /* 7.18.2.3  Limits of fastest minimum-width integer types */
00115 #define INT_FAST8_MIN       INT8_MIN
00116 #define INT_FAST16_MIN      INT16_MIN
00117 #define INT_FAST32_MIN      INT32_MIN
00118 #define INT_FAST64_MIN      INT64_MIN
00119 
00120 #define INT_FAST8_MAX       INT8_MAX
00121 #define INT_FAST16_MAX      INT16_MAX
00122 #define INT_FAST32_MAX      INT32_MAX
00123 #define INT_FAST64_MAX      INT64_MAX
00124 
00125 #define UINT_FAST8_MAX      UINT8_MAX
00126 #define UINT_FAST16_MAX     UINT16_MAX
00127 #define UINT_FAST32_MAX     UINT32_MAX
00128 #define UINT_FAST64_MAX     UINT64_MAX
00129 
00130 /* 7.18.2.4  Limits of integer types capable of holding object pointers */
00131 #if __WORDSIZE == 64
00132     #define INTPTR_MIN          INT64_MIN
00133     #define INTPTR_MAX          INT64_MAX
00134     #define UINTPTR_MAX         UINT64_MAX
00135 #else
00136     #define INTPTR_MIN          INT32_MIN
00137     #define INTPTR_MAX          INT32_MAX
00138     #define UINTPTR_MAX         UINT32_MAX
00139 #endif
00140 
00141 /* 7.18.2.5  Limits of greatest-width integer types */
00142 #define INTMAX_MIN          INT64_MIN
00143 #define INTMAX_MAX          INT64_MAX
00144 #define UINTMAX_MAX         UINT64_MAX
00145 
00146 /* 7.18.3  Limits of other integer types */
00147 #if __WORDSIZE == 64
00148     #define PTRDIFF_MIN         INT64_MIN
00149     #define PTRDIFF_MAX         INT64_MAX
00150 
00151     #define SIZE_MAX            UINT64_MAX
00152 #else
00153     #define PTRDIFF_MIN         INT32_MIN
00154     #define PTRDIFF_MAX         INT32_MAX
00155 
00156     #ifndef SIZE_MAX
00157         #define SIZE_MAX            UINT32_MAX
00158     #endif
00159 #endif
00160 
00161 #define SIG_ATOMIC_MIN      INT32_MIN
00162 #define SIG_ATOMIC_MAX      INT32_MAX
00163 
00164 #ifdef __WCHAR_MAX__
00165     #define WCHAR_MAX       __WCHAR_MAX__
00166 #else
00167     #define WCHAR_MAX       0x7fffffff
00168 #endif
00169 
00170 /* WCHAR_MIN should be 0 if wchar_t is an unsigned type and
00171    (-WCHAR_MAX-1) if wchar_t is a signed type.  Unfortunately,
00172    it turns out that -fshort-wchar changes the signedness of
00173    the type. */
00174 #if (WCHAR_MAX == 0xffff)
00175     #define WCHAR_MIN       0
00176 #else
00177     #define WCHAR_MIN       (-WCHAR_MAX - 1)
00178 #endif
00179 
00180 /*
00181  * wint_t is unsigned int in __MINGW32__, but unsigned short in MS runtime
00182  * JDP: changed to signed values
00183  */
00184 #define WINT_MIN        INT32_MIN
00185 #define WINT_MAX        INT32_MAX
00186 
00187 #endif /* !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined __STDC_LIMIT_MACROS */
00188 
00189 
00190 /* 7.18.4  Macros for integer constants */
00191 #if !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined (__STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS)
00192 
00193 /* 7.18.4.1  Macros for minimum-width integer constants
00194 
00195     Accoding to Douglas Gwyn <gwyn@arl.mil>:
00196     "This spec was changed in ISO/IEC 9899:1999 TC1; in ISO/IEC
00197     9899:1999 as initially published, the expansion was required
00198     to be an integer constant of precisely matching type, which
00199     is impossible to accomplish for the shorter types on most
00200     platforms, because C99 provides no standard way to designate
00201     an integer constant with width less than that of type int.
00202     TC1 changed this to require just an integer constant
00203     *expression* with *promoted* type."
00204 
00205     The trick used here is from Clive D W Feather.
00206 */
00207 
00208 #define INT8_C(val)     (INT_LEAST8_MAX-INT_LEAST8_MAX+(val))
00209 #define INT16_C(val)    (INT_LEAST16_MAX-INT_LEAST16_MAX+(val))
00210 #define INT32_C(val)    (INT_LEAST32_MAX-INT_LEAST32_MAX+(val))
00211 #define INT64_C(val)    (INT_LEAST64_MAX-INT_LEAST64_MAX+(val))
00212 
00213 #define UINT8_C(val)    (UINT_LEAST8_MAX-UINT_LEAST8_MAX+(val))
00214 #define UINT16_C(val)   (UINT_LEAST16_MAX-UINT_LEAST16_MAX+(val))
00215 #define UINT32_C(val)   (UINT_LEAST32_MAX-UINT_LEAST32_MAX+(val))
00216 #define UINT64_C(val)   (UINT_LEAST64_MAX-UINT_LEAST64_MAX+(val))
00217 
00218 /* 7.18.4.2  Macros for greatest-width integer constants */
00219 #define INTMAX_C(val)   (INTMAX_MAX-INTMAX_MAX+(val))
00220 #define UINTMAX_C(val)  (UINTMAX_MAX-UINTMAX_MAX+(val))
00221 
00222 #endif  /* !defined ( __cplusplus) || defined __STDC_CONSTANT_MACROS */
00223 
00224 #endif
Generated on Mon Jan 25 13:04:58 2010 for cr_lib by  1.5.8
